column4: what do i do now?  sorry i've never been in chat room before, very strange but good!
no, only max option is 640x480.
this is basically a notepad that 1300 persons can see and edit at the same time
if you have a question about ubuntu you just ask it.. please make sure you include information that is needed such as version of ubuntu and such
oh.. you have already.. nevermind me then =)
can you pastebin the file /var/log/Xorg.0.log

go to http://paste.ubuntu.com  .. you'll see a big text box.. open the file you want to pastebin in the regular text editor, select all text and copy it.. paste it into the webpage.. then press "submit" or "ok" (I can't remember which) and tell us the new url
ok.. I'll have a look
ok.. have a look at line 185
it says "(WW) NVIDIA(GPU-0): Unable to read EDID for display device CRT-0

EDID is a way for the graphics card to talk to the screen.. that way it knows what the screen can do and which resolutions it can show.. sometimes this doesn't work and then it uses some safe default values.. in this case 640x480
nah.. I get the same thing on my machine.. I just have to enter those values manually.. what kind of monitor do you have?
what's the resolution on that thing? 1024x768?
ok.. we've got horizontal frequency 30-75 kHz and vertical freq 30-75 Hz  .. remember those values
have a look at this file.. it's from my machine and the file is located at /etc/X11/xorg.conf
http://pastebin.com/f7adbfc17
the values we put in this file will override the automatic stuff.. so .. look at lines 30-37.. that's about my monitor
you see the values for HorizSync and VertRefresh ? thats't he place you need to put your valyes
so.. open a terminal and run "gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf"    copy paste that command if you want
you can copy the entire file if you want.. I don't think there's anything special in there
when you're done editing the file you just save it.. then we'll try rebooting
good luck
